page.title: 16Public House in Llangunllo
page.content: The Greyhound Inn is still essentialy a working farmers club and a male preserve.There are active Women's Darts teams and a Rounders team ( shared with the W.I. ) but still women do not use the pub as often as men, even if the days are gone when it was seen as a ' House of Sin ' not to be entered by a woman evem to buy cigarettes. The coming of the Car and Television means that the pub is no longer the place where farmers meet after six months absence at Christmas, spontaneous sing songs only happen at celebrations now but it is still the social centre for local farmers.The trophies won by the male darts and dominoes teams, as well as by women, are displayed proudly above the bar.
